what a thread
do you agree that a rank 2 matrix can represent an affine transform in a very high dimensional vector space?

that is mostly true and I think actually an important insight. the workhorse of deep learning is the GEMM matmul operation of some scale. in some architectures the atom is 4x4, sometimes 4x4x4, 256x256. it is the capacity for exactly this we are producing on an industrial scale

there’s more variance in the atomic operation due to many types of precision, different chips, but it’s basically true that the world is spending a lot of resources on producing more atomic matmuls per second, as they are the vast majority of compute in a modern DL workload

can someone explain why you’d ever put computers anywhere off planet? the only reason seems to me to be the far future one where we’re dumping too much waste heat into the earth system which is very far off
ok, I can get the need to run things near absolute zero. is the idea that this should extend to low temp superconducting computers?
keep in mind putting things on the moon is a lot more expensive than putting them in orbit, where there is no heat sink
